p: Infection caused by severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), agent of corona virus disease 2019 (COVID-19), has emerged in December 2019 in Wuhan, China and spread globally on all continents [ 1]. People living with HIV (PLWH) represent 37.9 million worldwide with a substantial proportion of the population in certain countries [ 2]. Notably, South Africa, where one out of five adults lives with HIV, has reported its first COVID-19 case on 5 March 2020 [ 3]. Incidence and severity of respiratory virus infection, such as influenza, is higher in PLWH as compared with HIV-uninfected patients. PLWH have an increased risk of hospitalization, more prolonged hospitalization and death following influenza infection [ 4].
